item.title: Remembering the Barbary Coast Hotel & Casino: A Vintage Vegas Gem
item.description:
A Stylish Alternative Rises on the Four Corners

The Las Vegas Strip in the late 1970s was dominated by sprawling mega-resorts. But nestled at the bustling intersection of Las Vegas Boulevard and Flamingo Road – the legendary “Four Corners” – a different kind of experience was about to emerge. On March 2, 1979, the Barbary Coast Hotel & Casino opened its doors, offering a sophisticated and intimate alternative to the increasingly colossal properties that defined the era.
